issue.title: PATCH call for symbol upload API should return accurate results

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

### POST request

```
POST /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

### POST response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:33:12 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 397
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, POST
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{"symbol_upload_id":"00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f","upload_url":"https://hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net:443/hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D","expiration_date":"2020-11-18T05:33:12.145Z”}
```

### PUT request

```
PUT /hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D HTTP/1.1
x-ms-blob-type: BlockBlob
Content-Type: application/zip
Host: hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 10779119

PK
âoQComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/UT	8»°_Á°_uxõPK
âoQ&ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ0ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ6ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK âoQ¹Í»_9¦AComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/ComickazeQLUT	8»°_8»°_uxõìÜy|LçâÇñAì-±Ç»¢¤Ö }ßCm5$E'É43!ÔÔN«©ZkWu¹Éµ×VT/­-riíMUUR½µÜ$ßÏÈ$¹¹¿Îë5¯ã}Îs¾óseæ$qúß¿>)l0ä+`0¥½Òþm8_Æðl©öòH{­Ðve×ZÍ7M5åo7½ÝsS¶çK/T¢^iK~¶<
]Õ
kåüî	ni¢ÓÂFß®Ã|
…
```

### PUT response

```
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Length: 0
Content-MD5: Mkz8TifLPEcFLWoWBZigAA==
Last-Modified: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:35:39 GMT
ETag: "0x8D88ABA9E2A8E46"
Server: Windows-Azure-Blob/1.0 Microsoft-HTTPAPI/2.0
x-ms-request-id: b47691b5-b01e-0099-06a3-bca561000000
x-ms-version: 2018-03-28
x-ms-request-server-encrypted: true
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:35:39 GMT
Connection: close
```

### PATCH request

```
PATCH /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads/00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 22

{"status":"committed”}
```

### PATCH response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:38:10 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 282
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, DELETE, PATCH
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{
    "symbol_upload_id": "00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f",
    "app_id": "78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199",
    "user": null,
    "status": "committed",
    "symbol_type": "Apple",

    /* Expected ["bundle 1.dSYM", "bundle 2.dSYM", "bundle 3.dSYM"] */
    "symbols_uploaded": [],

    "origin": "User",
    "file_name": "some_dSYMS.zip",

    /* Expected 10779119, matching the content size of the PUT request */
    "file_size": 0,

    "timestamp": "2020-11-17T05:38:10.355Z"
}
```

Duplicate of closed issue #2052)

issue.title: PATCH call for symbol upload API should return accurate results

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

issue.title: PATCH call for symbol upload API should return accurate results

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

### POST request

```
POST /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

### POST response

```

```

x-ms-blob-type: BlockBlob

Host: hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net

User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 10779119

âoQ&ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ0ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ6ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK âoQ¹Í»_9¦AComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/ComickazeQLUT	8»°_8»°_uxõìÜy|LçâÇñAì-±Ç»¢¤Ö }ßCm5$E'É43!ÔÔN«©ZkWu¹Éµ×VT/­-riíMUUR½µÜ$ßÏÈ$¹¹¿Îë5¯ã}Îs¾óseæ$qúß¿>)l0ä+`0¥½Òþm8_Æðl©öòH{­Ðve×ZÍ7M5åo7½ÝsS¶çK/T¢^iK~¶<
